definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: She usually poor-mouths when it's her turn to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 轮到她捐钱时，她老是哭穷。

sentences.english: At the reservation counter, when her turn came, there was only one ticket left.
sentences.chinese: 在预售票处，轮到她的时候，只剩下最后一张票了。

sentences.english: My heart turned over when my turn was coming round.
sentences.chinese: 轮到我时，我的心怦怦乱跳。

sentences.english: Now, turn right to comfort less sister.
sentences.chinese: 现在，轮到右少来安慰姐姐了。

sentences.english: Play ally, armor, weapon, item, and ability cards during your turn.
sentences.chinese: 轮到你的回合时，使用军队，甲胄，武器，能力。

sentences.english: 33 of the 72 slots were already filled when she reached in.
sentences.chinese: 轮到她时，72个入学名额已有33个被抽走了。

sentences.english: And it was her turn to finish the exercises of lesson 142 in the textbook this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上，轮到她完成第一百四十二课的练习了。

sentences.english: It was the turn to wash them yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天轮到你把它们洗洁净。

sentences.english: The myth here is that you must wait until it is "your turn" to speak.
sentences.chinese: 该处的误解是你必须等到轮到你的时候才说话。

sentences.english: It was now his turn to misjudge his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 现在轮到他低估自己的对手了。

sentences.english: KOTORI :It's my turn to make dinner, right? I'll make your favorite, steamed rice with edible wild plants.
sentences.chinese: 轮到我做晚饭了，对吗？我做你最喜欢的，野菜蒸饭。

sentences.english: It was now his turn to look about in perplexity .
sentences.chinese: 现在轮到他莫名其妙地四处张望了。

sentences.english: Even the bones were sold out before my turn.
sentences.chinese: 轮到我的时候连骨头都卖光了。

sentences.english: It was like, 'Who died and left you the boss?' " he said.
sentences.chinese: 好像在说，‘谁死了，轮到你当老板？’

sentences.english: Now is his chance to surprise us.
sentences.chinese: 现在机会当前，轮到由登盛来带给我们惊奇了。

sentences.english: He assumed he was next in line for the editorship.
sentences.chinese: 他原以为下一个一定轮到他当编辑。

definition: to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to the end (of)/at the end of/in the end/to come to an end
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
